result.execSummary:
The defendant Lara P Botts was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of drug paraphernalia adopting 961.573(1). This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 2 day(s) RCJ for contempt for failure to pay.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lara P Botts

Notice of 11/19/15 Hearing to deft - Return to sender - Insufficient address; unable to forward.
copy of letter from State Public Defender - not eligible

Pre-trial conference at 11-19-2015 03:15 pm.
Status conference at 12-21-2015 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the co-defendant, IML. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Lara P Botts in court with attorney Gregory Austin Holdahl.  Defendant Lara P Botts in custody.  Lillian V. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, p-ng, bond set.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 03:15 pm.  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
